raw_text: This alternate decoding path model was developed by Birch et al (2007)
clean_text: This alternate decoding path model was developed by Birch et al (2007).

raw_text: However, Birch et al (2007) showed that this approach captures the same re-ordering phenomena as lexicalized re-ordering models, which were not included in the baseline
clean_text: However, Birch et al (2007) showed that this approach captures the same re-ordering phenomena as lexicalized re-ordering models, which were not included in the baseline.

raw_text: Birch et al (2007) then investigated source-side CCG super tag features, but did not show an improvement for Dutch-English.Subotin (2011) recently extended factored translation models to hierarchical phrase-based translation and developed a discriminative model for predicting target-side morphology in English-Czech
clean_text: Birch et al (2007) then investigated source-side CCG super tag features, but did not show an improvement for Dutch-English.

citing_paper_authors: Amittai, Axelrod | Xiaodong, He | Jianfeng, Gao
raw_text: Lastly, Koehn and Schroeder (2007) reported improvements from using multiple decoding paths (Birch et al, 2007) to pass both tables to the MosesSMT decoder (Koehn et al, 2003), instead of directly combining the phrase tables to perform domain adaptation
clean_text: Lastly, Koehn and Schroeder (2007) reported improvements from using multiple decoding paths (Birch et al, 2007) to pass both tables to the Moses SMT decoder (Koehn et al, 2003), instead of directly combining the phrase tables to perform domain adaptation.

citing_paper_authors: Amittai, Axelrod | Xiaodong, He | Jianfeng, Gao
raw_text: This fast and simple technique for discarding over 99% of the general-domain training corpus resulted in an increase of 1.8 BLEU points. We have also shown in passing that the linear interpolation of translation models may work less well for translation model adaptation than the multiple paths decoding technique of (Birch et al, 2007) .These approaches of data selection and model com bi nation can be stacked, resulting in a compact, two phrase-table, translation system trained on 1% of the available data that again outperforms a state-of-the art translation system trained on all the data
clean_text: We have also shown in passing that the linear interpolation of translation models may work less well for translation model adaptation than the multiple paths decoding technique of (Birch et al, 2007).

raw_text: Finally, Birch et al (2007) exploit factored phrase-based translation models to associate each word with a super tag, which contains most of the information needed to build a full parse
clean_text: Finally, Birch et al (2007) exploit factored phrase-based translation models to associate each word with a supertag, which contains most of the information needed to build a full parse.

citing_paper_authors: Xianchao, Wu | Takuya, Matsuzaki | Jun'ichi, Tsujii
raw_text: Birchet al (2007) also reported a significant improvement for Dutch-English translation by applying CCG super tags at a word level to a factorized SMT system (Koehn et al, 2007)
clean_text: Birch et al (2007) also reported a significant improvement for Dutch-English translation by applying CCG supertags at a word level to a factorized SMT system (Koehn et al, 2007).

raw_text: We performed various experiments combining the original and an additional training bi-text: Two-tables: We built two separate phrase tables for the two bi-texts, and we used them in the alter native decoding path model of Birch et al (2007)
clean_text: We built two separate phrase tables for the two bi-texts, and we used them in the alter native decoding path model of Birch et al (2007).

citing_paper_authors: Rui, Wang | Petya, Osenova | Kiril, Simov
raw_text: Birch et al (2007) and Hassan et al (2007) have shown the effectiveness of adding su per tags on the target side, and Avramidis and Koehn (2008) have focused on the source side ,translating a morphologically-poor language (English) to a morphologically-rich language (Greek)
clean_text: Birch et al (2007) and Hassan et al (2007) have shown the effectiveness of adding supertags on the target side, and Avramidis and Koehn (2008) have focused on the source side ,translating a morphologically-poor language (English) to a morphologically-rich language (Greek).

citing_paper_authors: Rui, Wang | Petya, Osenova | Kiril, Simov
raw_text: Our approach is slightly different from (Birch et al, 2007) and (Hassan et al, 2007), who mainly used the super tags on the target language side, English
clean_text: Our approach is slightly different from (Birch et al, 2007) and (Hassan et al, 2007), who mainly used the super tags on the target language side, English.

raw_text: Probabilistic models for using only source tags were investigated by Birch et al (2007), who attached syntax hints in factored SMT models by having Combinatorial Categorial Grammar (CCG) super tags as factors on the input words, but in this case English was the target language
clean_text: Probabilistic models for using only source tags were investigated by Birch et al (2007), who attached syntax hints in factored SMT models by having Combinatorial Categorial Grammar (CCG) super tags as factors on the input words, but in this case English was the target language.

raw_text: In order to reduce these problems, decoding needed to consider alternative paths to translation tables trained with less or no factors (as Birch et al (2007) suggested), so as to cover instances where a word appears with a factor which it has not been trained with
clean_text: In order to reduce these problems, decoding needed to consider alternative paths to translation tables trained with less or no factors (as Birch et al (2007) suggested), so as to cover instances where a word appears with a factor which it has not been trained with.

raw_text: Supertagging encapsulates more contextual information than POS tags and Birch et al (2007) report improvements when comparing a super tag language model to a baseline using a word language model 870only
clean_text: Supertagging encapsulates more contextual information than POS tags and Birch et al (2007) report improvements when comparing a super tag language model to a baseline using a word language model only.

raw_text: Factored translation models have also been used for the integration of CCG super tags (Birch et al, 2007), domain adaptation (Koehn and Schroeder, 2007) and for the improvement of English-Czech translation (Bojar, 2007)
clean_text: Factored translation models have also been used for the integration of CCG super tags (Birch et al, 2007), domain adaptation (Koehn and Schroeder, 2007) and for the improvement of English-Czech translation (Bojar, 2007).
